content: Yeah, just get it
One of the best most challenging games on the Google Play store. No micro transactions . Just a good sold strategy game. I HIGHLY recommend this game!!!
Very tactical
Extremely unforgiving and tedious.

Tutorial is meant to teach you, not to crush you. There's a glitch when looking cards from equipment, cards will cover some info cuz they are on top. Missing info about how to changey class, just LOCKED and nothing more. It resets counters after killing mobs from a phase, really? Make it after a level.. frustrating game, it is. For everyone out there, read 3* reviews and lower and you'll see how this game is cheating on you. Uninstalling

Card Quest is a really interesting and fun pseudo-deckbuilder. You don't build your deck traditionally, card by card. Instead, as you play with each class, you permanently obtain new pieces of equipment that change their deck when you equip them. There are three dungeons to play through, each with different monsters and different rewards for each character. The combat is fun, as you usually juggle five or six different monsters, and have to balance attack and defense. Text is a bit too small.
Lots of depth, hard but rewarding.
Could be a great game if it was more balanced

Downright tough! A very good game in which every single action has weight, there's zero fluff. Many hours of gameplay here. From someone who enjoys traditional roguelikes and deckbuilders like Slay the Spire I can absolutely recommend this fresh take on the genres.

Fix the bugs in the character select screen. Wana switch to lich as wizard, i can't see what the lich does cause the cards are on top of the window. Same with the level window. Also make the cards stop blinking hold to zoom. I can read and i am not a moron so i can't read what the card says unless i hold cause the text hold to zoom keeps blocking my view. If this is fixed this is a 5star game. Do your jobs
Really good deep strategy rogue like game. Lots of combos and play styles to figure out. Well worth the purchase
Meh

Super fun, but very intricate game. Combat is deceptively simple at first, but ramps up very quickly. There is a lot of reading necessary to understand how yoir cards interact with each other. Should also be noted that while similar in game design to Slay the Spire, it plays nothing like that. But that's a good thing! Currently having a blast with berserker class with axes, and have almost completed one run. Oh, one last thing, the tutorials can feel brutal, but it's just a numbers puzzle.
Terrible balancing. Gameplay is incredibly linear. You're better off playing Rogue Adventure if you're itching for a nice deckbuilding rogue like.

Fun but geez...turn down the difficulty from Dark Souls to Devil May Cry at least. Near impossible to get past the first 2-3 stages, especially with the wizard and rogue. Archer is the "easiest" and warrior is very meh but sometimes lucky.
Game is fun it is a nice card game with a way to customize how you play but you will need to beat certain dungeons to get the cards you need to customize to how you play.
Text is annoyingly difficult to read
Top 3 all time rogue-like cardgame on mobile
Impossibly difficult. Tried all four classes and could not progress beyond the first level with any of them. Needs serious rebalancing.
Won't even download.
Game play is OK, but the graphics are horrible. The font is multi-colored and hard to read,

+1 star for Play Pass availability. Maybe this kind of game isn't for me based on others' great reviews. The tutorial - the part of the game that teaches you how to play - was too difficult for me to complete. There isn't any explanation as to WHY the cards chosen aren't suitable. Only 'you fail, try again.' If the tutorial is too hard, the game probably will be, too.

Very cool game and idea, however i have several issues with it after playing it for a couple weeks now. 1. As you progress, you get less useful cards and eventually die because you get cards that you can't use and hidden enemies that show up and attack when you haven't gotten any defence cards. It seems cheap, like the game cheats to win. 2. Once you die, you have to start ALL OVER at the beginning, only to get the same cheap, cheating results over and over. VERY FRUSTRATING GAME.

This game is super fun. There's a learning curve, and it took a couple tries to really connect with it, but if you like card games, this is great. Protip: save stamina for blocking! All of the blocks are actually very useful.
The type is rediculously small old English, and has a gradient, which makes it impossible to read easily. Only Bold sans-serif fonts work in these sort of games.

The 500+ hours of content is probably just ow long it willtake to beat the first level, a good game but if you want something you can play just for fun then find somthing else, you want a hardcore challenge then go right on ahead. Text is hard to read even on a larger screen, but I mean its an ok game, just not for me.
It's not really a deck builder. It's also not very good.
Great rogue deck builder. Completely different feel compared to Slay the Spire, but still amazing. Highly recommend!
Great game that requires strategy while still offering diverse combat options and enemies.
I genuinely can't name a game on mobile that I enjoy more then this one. It's the sort of game I play when home, not just as a means to pass the time at work.

I became so addicted to this game! Litterally couldnt stop playing for hours. It is challenging but not impossible. Even though the game never promted me for a review, Im giving one because it is just that awesome!
One of the best games on Android. The 4 classes all play so differently from each other. Just make sure you play the tutorial for a class before going into the main game. 100% Worth the price.
5 stars for a great lil deckbuilding game. Issue came up and was promptly fixed.

Well-crafted gameplay mechanics that fit the roguelike rather well. They are fair, but punish hard for mistakes. The rules seemed simple at first, but after several playthroughs I came to appreciate how the characters play differently. The variability in the builds keeps me coming back from time to time, althoug it has been a couple of years since my first run.
Latest updates reset the progress.. edit: progress issue fixed..
Good game
Game is Great, Developer! However, the newest update somehow deleted my game files : (

The gameplay is good. Even if you play the wrong card, you still can get back to things pretty easily, BUT the tutorial doesn't encapsulate that. If you play the wrong card in the tutorial, you lose not long after. Which makes the wrong impression that you need to play cards in the perfect order. For those who were annoyed because the Wizard is notably hard to play; try getting the Mirror Scroll in the first location in the Enchanted Forest. It's easy to use since it needs a different resource.

This game has been great and a lot of fun, with a good variety of strategies to how you want to play. It has a lot of content, and I've enjoyed exploring the different character archetypes of the different classes. I would love to see more, and am wondering if the developers have any thoughts towards adding any DLC characters or maps?

My favourite when it comes to deck crawlers. The emphasis here is in constantly keeping check of card setup and use order to adapt to different enemies. Even though its been so long now, i still crave, and hope for, a sequel. The art style is simple, yet it does create a really nice atmosphere.

Fantastic game, very deep, with great longevity. The unlocks/characters are very diverse with a lot of play styles, thay can drastically shift your tactics with every inventive combination. I would love for a sequel.

Never write reviews, but this game deserves it. Main thing is, don't let the tutorial discourage you. I almost gave up on the game, and then it started clicking. Actual game is much more forgiving than tutorial. Great Game Devs!

Challenging game requiring some luck and lots of card use planning and stamina rationing. However some builds seems unplayable due to insufficient ' energy ' from the start, necromancy using too much HP for souls compared to consumption rate, pyromancy always end up roasting myself to 0 HP instead. Hope there's cloud save feature change of phone means need start all over.
Great game. Would be nice if it had google play achievements too...
This is game is absolutely amazing. Difficult, yet balanced. Gameplay loop is absolutely addicting. I've been playing it frequently for over a year now.
This game is a hard roguelike, there is no gold for you to earn between runs. You either progress or not.
great game, prefer it to slay the spire, although they shouldn't be compared. this is quite unique rather than being a StS clone like every other roguelike deckbuilding game in the play store.

Bought this game over a year ago and still play it regularly. Easily put in at least 100 hours and only recently got to my first end screen. Every win or loss felt 100% earned. You can tell the devs put a lot of time and care into this game and the experience is well worth the price of admission. 10/10 would buy again. Only complaint i can of is the UI. It's a little clunky and outdated. Feels a lot like an old MS-DOS game but, who knows, could be intentional given the game's similar aesthetic.

This is absolutely the best game I have ever played in the Google Play library. If you are a fan of 80s/90s 8-bit RPGs and the recent trend of rogue-like turn-based card games, this will quickly become your favorite game. After the initial purchase you have 100% control of the game with 0 ads. I hope that this company puts out another game soon. Please! I have already logged 100 hours and I'm not even a fraction of the way through. (Best played on a large screen) A++

This game is hard but I like the challenge. Simple, card based combat, but items and deck upgrades can make it very strategic. The graphics are basic but done well. Once you get into it, it's hard to stop playing.
This game is my favorite mobile game. I wish the developer would make more games.

A great dungeon crawler that supports many different playstyles across 4 characters. Lots of secrets to uncover. Tons of replayability. Just as fulfilling to play for 5 minutes or 2 hours. Easily one of my favorite mobile gamea ever!
Great card game. This and gloomhaven have been a hit for me the last few years.
The game is working great, it's exactly what you want in a a card game, and it works offline now ads or banners, great work

Great concept and very good execution. My gripes: 1. There is no endgame. Once you have your powerful equipment you've pretty much beaten the game. 2. Unlocking subclasses can be ridiculously difficult because the combinations are not optimal or even good - e.g. to unlock Storm Master you need to use a defensive equipment that can block 6 once per turn and 3 otherwise, on a boss/dungeon that hits for 4+ at range. 3. Warrior and Mage are very OP compared to the other two classes.
Amazing roguelike card game
One of the best deck based roguelites I've ever played, regardless of platform
Great card game no microtransactions 10/10 good job
The text is way too small on my Note 4 and the gradient makes it hard to read. Note 4 stylus doesn't work with the game.
Great

Different classes each with distinct and customizable ways to play. Lots of fun. The only problem was after finding the ultimate class/playstyle I didn't have anything left to kill with it! Well worth the money though.

This might be my favorite mobile game. Kind of like slay the spire, tons of replayability, 4 very different and customizable classes. Lots of fun. However, the game will randomly crash and wipe my data. It doesnt happen very often but it takes a long time to unlock all the weapons for each class and it REALLY sucks to go back through it all over and over. Perhaps cloud save would fix things? I feel bad giving this great game a low rating, but this problem makes it not worth playing for me.

Challenging and smooth gameplay. Missing a bit of reason to bring me back to the game after beating a few paths. I wish there was a bit of an endgame i guess, but honestly by this point I have gotten many hours of gameplay and it is totally worth picking this game up.
Best card game on Android! Beats the hell out of Hearthstone, that's for sure. One time purchase, loads of content, challenging, and fun!
my favorite game on android.

Edit: I upgraded 1 to 3 simply because I can't find any other card dungeon game that's like this. I would give it 5 but there's a major game breaking glitch that wipes your saves and makes it nigh impossible to recover lest you're rooted and have titanium backup AND had the foresight to back up the game before the glitch. I restarted and built back to where I was finally and have yet to experience the same issue. If you take precautions I mentioned this is a really unique and good card crawler.
fantastic
There's already plenty of content and yet I still want more
This game is so hard. I hate it.
a great little game, lots of variety, supprisling deep tactics, and so on. only wish there were more quests, 3 seems not enough.

I am in love. The customization, the combos, the unlocks. Everhthing feels good and you defjnitely get that RPG feel of growing stronger over time. Keep it up. Also, any plans for an expansion with more dungeons? I'm not even halfway done (after 25+ hours) but I already know I'll want more.

It's good, really good! But there's quite a few bugs. Some enemies hit twice when you force them to get distance even though they're only melee and have no ranged attack, and the aspect of the crow doesn't work.
good
really fun roguelike card game. I havent played slay the spire but this game beats out all the other android spire-likes I've tried.

Good adventuring deck builder. @devs: [0] imho, the game needs a (centralized and also contextual) glossary. What is a defenseless target? How does poison work? What is a critical strike? Details about miasma cloud... [1] at end of wizard training final test 3rd turn, he congratulates the player even if he lose, probably because it checks survival befere the damage are taken into account [2] after I complete a training, I have to close the game in order to have access to the other trainings
Worth every penny! Got alot hours out of the game!

So much variety. Worth the effort to get into for all the exquisite styles of play among the different classes. Excellent design. Edit: I believe this is the best game I have played on the play store.

Definetely get your bang for buck here. Every hero is different with all kinds of customizations, no hidden microttransactions, it's decently challenging with few balance issues, simple UI...honestly one of the best if not the best roguelike card game for android.

Good card combat game for big screens. ---- I'm afraid to say I had to turn off the music entirely as I've been listening to the same song from MacLeod in another commercial game that I've spent countless of hours on ;)
Great game, only gripe I have is that it needs larger font option for smartphone sized devices.
This is one of my favorite Steam games. Love having it on mobile.
Had so many hours of fun.
very addicting game for the people who like card games and strategy
nice

In a world plagued by pay to win mobile games, this game is an incredible and refreshing style of rogue like and is a pleasure to play. Unfortunately, it seems that the melee classes are outclassed by their ranged companions. The game seems much more difficult when you play as the melee classes.

Card quest is a solid rogue-like strategy game. The equipment changes will effect your tactics (sometimes substantially), allowing each person to have a favorite style. I look forward to Black Shell putting out another game in this style, or adding new content. Keep up the good work!

Very seldom does a title live up to its pitch as described in store, this title manages exactly that. This game is, admittedly dense to learn, but the tutorials coerce users into playing the game correctly. Users are rewarded in 20-45 minute sessions with new options to build around. Character limit withstanding, this game is so excellent i would have to write a full journalistic review to properly cover this, so I'll be brief, buy this game. Devs, make a sequel, see if you can get it on console

A solid card game with depth. Coming from the likes of Slay the Spire, i dont like the limited control over the cards in your deck. If you like deck building on the fly then this game is lacking. It offers a repetitive series of encounters with preset combinations of decks that requires an investment of time to fully make use of. This is not a roguelike where theres nothing to unlock and every run has equal possibilities, and for me it is a grind without the strategic deck building element.
Great game, but lacks the feature of saving game progress across instalations. I have lost my progress and now I'm kinda sad ((
super hard. but great gameplay
Easily the best card roguelike I have played on mobile. Unlocks can be mixed and matched to turn any of the four classes into any of several different combat styles between matches.
awesome game. if you love slay the spire this is the same kind of game. i love it and it's cheap the hours of play you can get from it
Difficult but deeply strategic and highly addictive!

This game speaks to me on a spiritual level. If you like unlocking variable powers, run based gameplay, and feeling like a smarty pants, you owe it to yourself to give it a try. Each new area and enemy feels thematic and interesting. I would gladly purchase expansion material in the future and look into the developers' further work. Though the deckbuilding is package based, Card Quest stands shoulder to shoulder with genre favorites like Dream Quest and Slay the Spire.

BEFORE YOU BUY This is a challenging roguelike that requires careful thinking, trial and error, and preparing for bad luck draws of cards and deck building. Make sure you understand how each card works and combos and DO THE TUTORIALS. This isn't a mindless game, you can just smash through, you will die a lot as you try to obtain loot and get more powerful. If you crave depth and challenge, I highly recommend this game.

This game will beat you down until you get it right, and I love it for that. Varied enemies, playstyles, and items combine to make this a very fun, if not incredibly difficult game. If you do not enjoy hard games with a surprising amount of depth, then use your money on a game for children or a freemium game, because this one is not meant for either. Best game on the app store, on par with many of the big name games (Xcom, Civilization, etc.) and well worth the money.
Dungeon crawler + card game + rpg. No microtransactions or ads. Doesn't seem to have cloud save option, though
Yep. Pretty amazin game. I already sunk quite a few hours into this and I haven't even really played other characters. That will prolong the game even more
so much startegic depth, doesnt saddle me with cards i dont like, a lot of options. great games would give 6 stars if an option. graphics could use an update but thats fine.
like slay the spire but better
I really enjoyed this game, please make a sequel!
pretty sweet game. thr graphics are a bit sad, but the decks enemies and builds are great, good job.
one of best games that ive found to play on a mobile

Best game i have ever played on android. Nice puzzle, ressource and card management dungeon crawl with loads of character customization and a great overall feeling. I seldom write reviews, but man this game is totally worth its price tag! I only wish there was cloud sync. Cheers
In-depth tactics, excellent card game - love it!
one of the best card games on Android! great mechanics and a high but not to unfair difficulty curve. Would love an update with more areas or new characters!
Great game. Hard but once u get the hang of it will keep u entertained for hours.

Great idea, good execution, lots of grind. its a rogue like in a card game. if incremental power grinds are your thing then this is for you. i like them but not on my phone, i dont have that kind of time.
This game is awful. It is impossible to get to the end with any of the classes. It's not a matter of luck of the draw or skill. Worst card game ever!
A real gem! I was expecting a slay the spire clone, but this is a really original and interesting card based roguelike.
bad

This is probably the best mobile game I've ever played! The amount of depth and creativity is astounding! Please port this over to the Switch. I would buy it immediately even if it was $40. Typically mobile games interest me for maybe 2 days tops. I seriously cannot put this down and spend as much time as I'm able to playing. Thank you for making this!

The player is offered very little choice, limited strategy or deck modification, and it plays the same every time. I love single player card games, especially rogue like dungeon crawlers, but this one wasnt good at all.
Fantastic card based game. I hope the developers apply their craft to more great timewasters.
The game before Slay the Spire xD love this to bits thanks for porting it over!
Fun game. I put off buying it for a while due to the price tage, but it is well worth it. It srains your battery pretty bad while playing though.

You beat the dungeons using cards mechanics. There is 4 class, each has differe t difficulty and gameplay. Expect lot of unlocks make you chase after them, and stories with events. Don't worry about price, no iap, tens of hour gameplay.
wish more devs would have the integrity to make games like card quest. you get what you pay for and the gameplay loop is flush to the brim with unlockables and varied classes. awesome game.

This is it. This is the app I've been looking for. I sat on this game for a while and wish I hadn't. I was turned off by the graphics but this game is phenomenal. If you like card games at all, buy this! I've already lost so many hours to this game and I've barely exhausted its content. I knew from the moment I played the tutorial that I was on to something good. Each of the 4 classes offer very different play styles. It's very challenging and if you lose it's usually because you screwed up.

Great game, has no in app purchases and has enough content to play for quite awhile. There is a rouguelike element in runs but there is also progression by unlocking certain gear that u can keep for future runs. Hope even more content will be added in the future
please add an option for larger text/ no gradient. its very hard to read the cards
I feel like I played a real video game, a great one and this is a good example of how mobile gaming should be. A valued experience With Out trying to get in to my wallet.

This game is fantastic! It's very well designed and a lot of fun to play. There's a slight learning curve, but well worth the effort. The level of depth to the mechanics is truly impressive, and I've only played the Wizard seriously so far. It's hard to say no to "one more run" each time.

Outstanding. This one really takes me back. Insanely difficult old school deck rpg. Gets a bit easier once you get more equipment and start to understand the mechanics of gameplay. Excellent replay value (four character classes + bonus sub classes). If you like tender pushover Rpg's then don't bother with this one; it is not for the weak hearted. You are not worthy... >:-)

Low grapghics but lots of fun. The game starts you with 4 characters and as you progress you unlock gear that changes how your characters react. It takes some trial and error to get right but the tutorial helps (and gives you a peice of loot to make your first dungeon a little easier). Certainly one of the better games and as you've probably already noticed no in ap purchases or advertisements to deal with.
Amazing game, I literally can't put it dowm, the 4 classes all are so different and have varying sets of skills. I'm going to keep playing until I 100% the game.
Addictive. Hard to master. perfect amount of grind and progression. no ads, no pay to win. just buy and enjoy.
One of the best games on Android: perfectly designed and highly replayable. I own this game on Steam, but loved it so much that had to purchase it here again. Thanks, dev, for this awesome work.
I really love the challange this game brings, and the music is amazing. i really hope you guys make another game like this. love you <3
Changing my review by bumping this up by a star. game is well done with challenging aspects.
Great game, the game mechanism is interesting and unique.
good game
Has a slower start, but very brilliant execution. Once you have a few options for deck building, the game really shines.
good game, just not for me.
Obtuse and poorly explained tutorials. Some cards are seemingly useless. Progression is slow and grindy.

Phenomenal game. I hardly ever write reviews unless it really impresses me. The roguelike/card combo has always been one of my favorites and this is one of the best. Up there with Slay the Spire and Monster Slayers.
This game is so hard to put down. My bathroom breaks at work are starting to become troublingly long. A great tactical card game with good art and fun and engaging game play

Love the combination of rpg and card game. This game really makes you feel like you are playing a specific class in an RPG, way more than games like hearthstone. Great challenge curve and you feel very rewarded when you unlock new items

Best best best game ! Please kindly add more expansion/ add on/ sequel or whatever goodies to this game, we will pay for it! how about making it a series!! Or make it having more storyline? This game is extremely addicting and fun! Thanks

I'm a pretty casual roguelike player - never really got deep into nethack, got to the bottom of pixel dungeon but it wasn't easy, etc. This game is just the right amount of difficult vs easy to remember. The card mechanic really helps in that respect, since i can just optimize the equipment combination like the noob i am. Only complaint is that the text is tiny, even in the blown up large view version. Still legible but i do feel like an old man squinting.
the best handheld game I've played so far!

Fantastic game that I didn't give enough credit at first. The more I unlocked though, the more the depth became apparent and it well and truly sucked me in. No adverts, no in app payment nonsense, just a really solid fun game that I've now lost countless hours to on my tablet. Highly recommended.
Took awhile to get into it, but once I figured out how to approach the different styles, it became a big puzzle to figure out how to avoid taking damage!
Very difficult at first, after some unlocks it gets great.
Wizard is waaaaay underpowered. Almost full unlocks for other classes, but can't make any progress here.

Why must every game be roguelike? So tired of it. I tried this because it claims you get to carry over some progress between missions and after failing, but i just wasted 40 minutes on the first set of levels only to die on the boss due to unlucky card pulls...and I'm back at zero progress. It's a shame, because I was having a lot of fun up to that point, but I don't have time to waste on null progress roguelike games.
Best value I got out of a game. Very repeatable, a lot of depth in it

Crazy amount of content, a little hard at first but you do get progression and stronger as you unlock more stuff. It is a rogue like so cna be frustrating if you die deep into a run, but really well done so far.
After being stuck two levels into each adventure, I hit the stride. Tough but fair game. Lots of customization. Fun and balanced. We'll worth it. Hope they roll out new content. Would support $ DLC
This game is pretty fun once you get the rhythm of the game pool play down. It not constantly asking me to pay money every 5 seconds is a huge plus as well.
I've been looking for a game like Slay the Spire on Android and this scratches that itch perfectly. For $5 I'm definitely not disappointed.
One of the best card games i played
Fun!
Great game. One of my favorites. Dragging cards to discard is a little finicky sometimes and would like Android mouse support but not deal breakers in the least.
Terrible! Played once, too easy, cards hard to read, poor graphics, terrible audio. Can't believe they charge for this game? Asked for a refund and got no response.

Why is the wizard completely useless? He's the only hero that can't physically clear any of the first levels. His health is too low, his defense cards always require lightning, its not a well thought out character. The others are good though.
Great game design.
Great game. Worth the cost

Dark souls of card games, you will fail allot but just like in DS you will learn the enemies strategy. Don't listen to the people who claim it's too hard, the game is a rogue like game so it's meant to be hard, any fan of dark souls or darkest dungeon will feel right at home here. Thank u devs for making a truly rewarding game
Insanely good. Every battle is a puzzle
Excellent
Quite a bit of gameplay, nice inter-game progression. Classes and specs feel quite different despite related mechanics.
Why make it impossible to win right off the bat if we cant beat the first level how are we suposed to play....!
Great game. Wish the Note S-Pen worked with it though...
Best strategy card game I've played on a phone. It is an RPG style, with 4 different classes. Single player only. Easy to put many, many hours into it.
Amazing, the more I play it the better it gets! Great buy!!

Card Dungeons older brother. Plays like classic JRPGs. Attacks and skills are cards. A fun challenging game. Classes have different play style and feel. As the fighter I discovered a item that let me evolve into a Beszerker and it changed my attacks and skills. It would be great if you could customize your deck. It would be nice to change your avatar a bit. A great challenging game.
Love this game. Lot of substances and replay value. It's challenging in a good way and not just hard for the sake of being hard. Thanks for the treasure dev.
Loads of fun, and much deeper than it appears. Quite challenging as well.
A Deep Game With Carefully Crafted Mechanics, Challenging -lots Of Replayability
This game is rad. I had been wanting a phone version of Slay the Spire, and this is just as good while still being unique and different.

Female heroe counterparts PLEASE! The shading at the bottom of the text makes it harder to read, creating eye fatigue. Other than these two things I love the game and will add 1 star for each issue if implemented!!

It is what it looks like: a card based combat rpg. I've played quite a few 
f2p games very similar. Not worth $5, wait for it to go on sale.

This is one of the best mobile games I've ever played. Well worth the 
price! As other reviews have noted, the variety in gameplay is fantastic. 
Not only is there variety with the different classes, but how you equip 
each class greatly effects gameplay. A class can play very differently with 
different equipment. Different levels and encounters reward different 
approaches. It feels like nitpicking, but balance could be a little better. 
I think there are certain builds that are clearly superior to others, 
regardless of the encounter. Some levels can feel tedious sometimes, too 
(ugh, Rotten Copse!). But do not let that dissuade you. This is a fantastic 
game, and if the concept sounds appealing to you at all, you won't regret 
the purchase.

One of the deepest card games I've had the chance to play. It's great fun  but really needs cloud saving and achievements to fully round out the package.  There's a ton of replay value in the different builds you can make.

Lots of variety between the different classes with many loadout options. A 
lovely blend of RPG and card game. I hope the devs add more levels/cards at 
some point.

Love this game... its a legitimate great game.. not only for mobile but on 
any platform. Visuals meh but servicable. Gameplay A+
So much worth. Reminds me of Slay the Spire, but I think I like this more.

This is a unique twist on a deck building game. Definitely worth the money. 
My only complaint is that the words are a bit small on a mobile screen. 
Either way, I've played many hours and I've only tried 1 class so far, and 
haven't beaten it yet.
Great dungeon run card game that is more addicting than it seems.
I expected a clone of many other roguelike card games, but was pleasantly surprised with this wholly original, addicting game. Absolutely fantastic!

please give us a way to change the font it's hard to read the words when 
the background is dark. and is there any way to turn off the flashing hold 
to zoom prompt when lookingat your cards?

Really not for me, just didn't get to the point where anything was 
enjoyable.
I LOVE this game, super fun and challenging!

My favorite Android game. Easy to learn, hard to master. Difficulty ramps 
up nicely although more on the difficult side. Different classes have a 
very different play style. Overall, a well balanced game for those who like 
strategy.

Fantastic game! Fun mechanics, and the classes are very unique and 
exciting. I had trouble reading a lot of the text, though. The default font 
is small and the gradient on it made it very hard to read stuff unless I 
magnified it :(

This game is great. It's challenging and keeps you playing with the gear 
unlocks and the fun of trying different builds. Definitely worth the money.

Game is great with deep tactics...however there is a game breaking bug 
where we loose all item progress. This is a serious issue. I have seen 
other people mention the same thing. Is there a plan to update and fix 
this? Thanks.
It's an actual game.

Awesome game! Love it so much! Just wish you would add cloud saving. I know 
its a roguelike but there is an option to reset data just wish there was an 
option to back up your data conveniently as well. Literally the only reason 
it's not 5 stars for me. Please add and I will update to 5 stars P.S. I 
never rate games but this one is really good. Well done!

A brilliant PvE Dungeon Crawler Card game, with well thought-out 
interesting gameplay mechanics, and incredible replayability. Each of the 4 
classes feel and play different and there a lot of artifacts/cards you can 
unlock. With the other cards each of the classes have 2-3 builds which also 
makes several runs with the same class feel different. I have been looking 
for something like Slay the Spire for the phone, and this is the perfect 
find. The graphics are a bit old-school but fit well, the controls are 
nice, the UI and status effects need some learning but are also well 
implemented. I can play and read everything on my 5,5" phone perfectly. The 
gameplay itself is simply super fun. I have played this game since buying 
it a few days ago for at least 10-15 hours, and will continue to do so many 
times that. The price is really low when you consider the amount of fun 
this game contains; it's especially surprising to find something like this 
on the Android store.
Amazing. Well worth the money. A lot of replay Value

Would rate higher but loading a game just results in blank windows and I 
don't want to start again every time

Fun game that is sorely lacking any kind of endgame, making the grind 
pointless. Also seems to be buggy. For instance, vanish is firing 100% of 
the time making my rogue run trivial. (Or I'm very very lucky). Mechanics 
are great and it's full of content, but needs an endgame for a perfect 
score.
Great game. Lots of depth, good progression.

I love this game soooo much, it is the best mobile game I have ever played. 
But it has a completely breaking bug where it wipes all progress seemingly 
at random. Has happened to me twice now, both times after significant hours 
put in. Can't bring myself to try a third time.l until is fixed.

Easily one of the best card game I've played. Super creative how each

The Dark Souls of roguelike card games! Haha, just kidding.

Lost me.

I loved this game on PC and I'm happy now I can replay it on the go. It's a 
very original card based RPG and the combat is surprisingly deep. Totally 
recommended!

Great game. Poor UI for phones. Please remove text gradient. The player

Stringing together chains and trying different builds makes this game easy 
to pick up and hard to put down.

The best mobile game for fans of strategy games or card games. Challenging 
and rewarding every step of the way.

Absolutely a great game, worth every penny. There is so much to unlock and 
explore.

Really good, definitely worth the price. It's impressive how different each 
class and weapon feels while using the same basic gameplay mechanics. One 
minor issue is that some resources are spent, while others are just used as 
a threshold that needs to be reached, but there's nothing that 
differentiates the two until you've used them.

Easily the best money I've spent on a phone game ever! Paying $5.00 for the 
70+ hours I've put into this for the last couple weeks is an unbelievably 
good valye, and I've only begun to master two of the four classes! Well 
done to the dev, I'm recommending this to all of my friends!

This is way better than I expected, and it deserves more exposure. 
Replayability is awesome and I've only played two classes in the 20 hours 
Ive sunk into it. The only issues I have is maybe better explanations of 
all statuses, units, etc from the battle screen; also I get input issues 
sometimes when selecting a target in the middle area of the screen, it will 
deselect the attack card instead. An undo button for using items would be 
great too, but that might defeat the purpose. Keep me updated with progress 
and changes, I'm willing to spend more to help development!
Excellent adventuring strategy card game

Can I rate this more than 5 stars?!? So addicting and worth going back at 
it over and over. Each characters play differently and even within a single 
class, you can collect different sets of cards to change your character 
gameplay. Just awesome!
Makes gameplay feel like actions

Really enjoying the game so far but I've been encountering a major deal 
breaker where if a quit out part-way through I run my progress seems to 
save on the title screen but when I try to load in it just hangs on a 
completely empty combat screen with nothing to interact with to progress

This is the first cellphone game that hooked me, it has a amazing amount of

I need more. Expansion, dlc, whatever. Just make more of this.

Game is really great. The initial learning curve is really brutal but if 
you can get over it you have a game with dozens of hours of awesome 
content. Absolutely worth the buy.
Very fun with lots of replayability.
Masterful game design. Very worth the money. Amazing work devs!

One of the best strategy games in recent memory, if not THE best. Not only 
does the game offer outrageous amounts of content, it is well designed and 
clever. I will undoubtedly be playing this for a VERY long time. Thanks for 
the amazing experience, guys.
Very high learning curve. Some fonts are too small, difficult to read

Great game, but font a little tiny on a smaller screen making it hard to

There seems like a lot of depth and game play. Pretty happy to find it.
Excellent game with many options and paths. You gear up your character and keep that gear which is pretty fun. Good sense of progression and plays really well.

YES. This is everything I want in a mobile game. Bit-sized sessions, easy to learn, hard to master, quaint homespun graphics, well-written stories and brilliant roguelike gameplqy mechanics! It's a roguelike with persistent progression (some items you find you can keep with you) changing up the way you play the game! I just  I just have two requests: maybe make an option to add in female characters (or character classes like a tank priestess or summoner with a lot of defensive "summon" buffs) and please, PLEASE port Sanctuary to mobile. If this happens I promise to never litter again (and to buy it, and all the goddamn dlc you can think off).

If was fun for a few hours, so it was worth the price of admission. That said, I think it could have used some more polish on the flow of gameplay. Three of the classes have enough resources to mitigate a bad turn due to draw, but the Wizard has half the energy as the others for no discernible reason, meaning he absolutely has to draw cards in the right order to both do well offensively and properly defend. His tiny health pool makes this worse, as even normal enemies can take him out if he either doesn't draw or doesn't have the resources for a block card for every single opponent.   This also leads to a catch-22 with the unlocking system. You have to beat areas with a class to get more options for that class, but if the options you have are countered by the areas you are trying to beat then you have to replay over and over hoping for perfection or give up. It makes for a frustrating experience where the gameplay is either easy due to lucky draws or impossible due to a bad draw followed by immediate loss.

This has quickly become one of my favorite games on Android. The graphics remind me of old C64 games in the best way. Character diversity and balance is also spot on. The dungeons and dialogue all create a very cohesive and enjoyable environment. I would love to see this game come to PC... (just Google'while typing this) it seems this is available on PC as well; sold!
Defined classic classes with fairly plenty customization, plus the quite simple yet engaging turn-based card gameplay, it is a perfect game for mobile. Great addition to my mobile game collection.
Excellent game! Better than Slay The Spire imo.
Great retro feeling and deep strategy.
Have this for PC.  Amazing game with tons of replayability!
Really fun and clever card game, I just wished there was cloud sync for the save file since I like to play on both phone and tablet.

Absolutely worth your time and money. Does a great job of making the classes feel unique. Hard to put down when you're on a streak, and harder still when you die and want to have another go at it. If the concept interests you, buy with confidence. Never left a review before, but this gem needs more attention.
An excellent card combat game. Move and card choice are complex. A very compelling game with excellent variety. Highly recommended.

Honestly wasn't sure if you could beat the first little area of the woods. . . It took a while. This game is so in depth, it's like dark souls made a crazy deck building RPG. . . I'm smitten. Well done and I will definitely will be sharing.

Note: The game does not seem to work with the SPen for some reason! I really like the game and WANT to love it, but am finding the tiny font very hard to read and I'm not sure if I'll continue playing it. The font is not only small (and I have  a big  phone), but each letter has some sort of a fade effect at the bottom which exacerbates things. The game, otherwise, is great.

Roguelike FTL overworld progression with "deck building" card combo chain combat that's fueled by a unique resource type for each of the 4 DnD flavor classes that each present their own strengths and challenges that you can unlock customizations for with story progress (which is hard as eff). Yessssssssssss
Amazing !

Was not expecting much, but there's a deep layer of strategy beneath the somewhat basic graphics. I'm enjoying this game very much and I'm glad to support the developper so he can make more games like this.
I was the 3rd person to download it!  Love it thus far.  Good old school feel w card mechanics.
Excellent card based dungeon crawler with branching paths like FTL and tons of replay value.
